intro: Spergula tunetana var. pseudopycnorrhiza, commonly known as the Tunisian spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant exhibits a low-growing, mat-forming habit, which helps it survive in harsh, dry environments. Its roots are thick and fleshy, allowing it to store water efficiently. This variety is notable for its adaptation to extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
